Lady Hawk reluctantly answered the question but avoided as many of the facts
as she could. "I arrived with a group of scientists. I was sent here to
study and experiment on the DNA of your group. you were pretty much in the
center of the commotion so this seemed the proper spot to begin." she knew
he wanted more than she could give without revealing information about her
father and Foxfingers. "I was dropped off while the others searched the
other planets in this galaxy. I was due back weeks ago, They've probably
abandoned me by now." she hoped that Zardus wouldn't think about the
heritage she'd already revealed, She was a princess, royalty wouldn't be
abandoned without proof of trouble.


----- Original Message -----
From: <Yanshosh@...>
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, March 06, 2001 4:40 PM
Subject: Re: Upgrade Completed


> ::Zardus::
>
> Zardus sits down in a chair, listening to Lady Hawk's story. So far
> she was just telling him things he already knew. He leans forward
> when she finishes.
>
> "The planet is, or was, very rich in energon. It attracted the
> attention of Megatron, and a Maximal crew followed him. That crew was
> carrying stasis pods, and some of those left up in space are still
> falling to the ground. But war itself attracts warriors, so the
> planet continues to be a battleground."
>
> He glances around the walls for a second. Ironically enough, the
> Conference rooms, ideally places for bots to come together and
> cooperate, were the most heavily defended rooms in the Iron Fist,
> aside from the engine room and the bridge.
>
> "But how did you get to the planet? When DevilDuer recruited you, he
> simply found you in a forest, or you found him. There isn't any
> information on how you got here."
>
>
>
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > Lady Hawk enters the conference room and steps to a table. she
> remains
> > standing waiting for Zardus to follow before taking a seat. "I came
> to this
> > planet because it showed a high concentration of Translife signs.
> from what
> > I've seen from your records I was correct."  she pulled her seat
> forward
> > interlocking her mands on the table top. The bot leaned
> forward, "It seemed
> > like a good place to continue DNA research." She didn't want to
> reveal her
> > true intentions but could see she was at a disadvantage. Zardus
> seemed to
> > have to sure of himself. The royal bird could see it in his
> manner. "What is
> > the attraction to this place? it seems to be a graveyard for stasis
> > pods?"she commented hoping to adjust the subject to her advantage.
>
>
>
